settings.title: Buying a Field Gate
settings.text: Field gates are essential for agricultural, equestrian, and residential properties, providing secure access and boundary control. Whether you need a gate for livestock, vehicle access, or simply to define property borders, this guide will help you choose the right field gate for your needs.

settings.cstm_tables_text1: What style of field gate are you after?

5 bar

Our 5 Bar Field Gates are a traditional and versatile choice for agricultural and residential use. Its sturdy five-bar design provides excellent visibility and security, making it ideal for controlling livestock and marking property boundaries. 

The classic design fits seamlessly into rural or garden settings, offering both practicality and aesthetic appeal.
settings.cstm_tables_text2:
Planed

Planed field gates are crafted from smooth, finely finished timber, giving them a polished and refined appearance. The planing process removes rough edges and imperfections, resulting in a sleek and uniform surface. These gates are perfect for residential properties or entranceways where aesthetics matter, offering a high-end look while maintaining the strength and durability needed for outdoor use.
settings.cstm_tables_text3:
Redwood

Scandinavian Redwood is known for its resistance to weathering, making it an ideal material for outdoor gates. Pressure-treated for longevity, our Redwood Field Gates are built to withstand the elements.

settings.cstm_tables_text1:
Curved Heel

Our Curved Heel Field Gate is a stylish upgrade to the standard field gate, featuring a smooth, rounded heel for added visual interest. This gate is both functional and attractive, making it suitable for farms, paddocks, or residential driveways. 

The curved heel design adds a touch of elegance while maintaining the strength and reliability needed for everyday use.
settings.cstm_tables_text2:
Rough Sawn

Rough sawn field gates are made from timber that retains its natural texture and character, giving the gate a more rustic and traditional appearance. This type of gate is ideal for agricultural or rural settings where a more natural, rugged look is desired. The rough sawn finish is highly durable and often more affordable, making it a practical choice for farms or properties that prioritise function over aesthetics.
settings.cstm_tables_text3:
Iroko

Our Hardwood Field Gates are made from high-quality African Iroko, known for its exceptional durability and resistance to decay. Iroko’s rich, warm color gives the gate a distinctive appearance, making it perfect for properties that require both strength and style. Ideal for driveways or agricultural use, this gate offers long-lasting performance with minimal maintenance.

settings.cstm_tables_text1:
Straight Heel

Our Straight Heel Field Gate offers a simple yet sturdy design, perfect for those looking for a traditional gate with clean lines. Ideal for agricultural or rural settings, this gate is built from high-quality timber and provides reliable access control. The straight heel construction ensures a strong and durable structure, making it a popular choice for farms and larger outdoor areas.
settings.cstm_tables_text2:
Galvanised

Galvanised field gates are made from durable steel that has been hot-dip galvanised to protect against rust and corrosion. Ideal for agricultural, industrial, or high-security settings, these gates offer exceptional strength and longevity, even in harsh outdoor environments. The galvanised coating provides a maintenance-free finish that withstands the elements, making it perfect for use in areas exposed to heavy rain or moisture.
settings.cstm_tables_text3:
Metal

Available with our without mesh, our Metal Field Gatesare a heavy-duty option designed for maximum security and durability. Ideal for industrial, agricultural, or large residential properties, this gate provides strong protection against unauthorised access. 

Low-maintenance and weather-resistant, metal gates are built to last, offering reliable performance in any environment. Its simple yet robust design ensures long-term functionality.

settings.title: 5 Bar/Diamond Brace
settings.answer: The 5 Bar/Diamond Brace Gate is a classic design, known for its iconic five-bar structure with a diamond bracing pattern for added strength. It's ideal for agricultural use, residential entrances, or paddock enclosures.
settings.image_text:
• Strength and Durability: The diamond brace adds extra reinforcement, ensuring long-lasting performance.
  • Versatile: Suitable for farms, driveways, and garden entrances, offering both function and style.
  • Visibility: The open five-bar design allows visibility while still providing security.

settings.title: Straight Heel
settings.answer: The Straight Heel Gate features a simple and sturdy design with a straight heel, offering a clean and classic look. It is a practical choice for agricultural or rural properties where function is a priority.
settings.image_text:
• Traditional Design: A timeless look that complements any rural or agricultural setting.
  • Cost-Effective: A budget-friendly option without compromising on strength.
  • Easy Installation: Simple construction makes it easier to install and maintain.

settings.title: Curved Heel
settings.answer: The Curved Heel Gate provides a touch of elegance to the standard field gate with its curved heel feature. It blends practicality with a more decorative look, making it perfect for residential entrances or stylish paddock fencing.
settings.image_text:
• Elegant Design: The curved heel adds visual appeal without sacrificing functionality.
  • Enhanced Aesthetic: Suitable for properties looking for a decorative, stylish gate.
  • Durability: Built from durable materials, ensuring long-term use.

settings.title: Metal Gate
settings.answer: Metal gates are heavy-duty and designed for maximum security and durability. They are commonly used for industrial, agricultural, and high-security areas due to their strength and resistance to wear and tear.
settings.image_text:
• High Security: Provides robust protection, ideal for securing properties.
  • Low Maintenance: Metal gates are resistant to rust, rot, and weathering.
  • Durability: Built to withstand heavy use and harsh outdoor conditions.

settings.title: Softwood Gate
settings.answer: Softwood gates are affordable and versatile, offering a natural look for agricultural or residential properties. Made from pressure-treated softwood, these gates are resistant to rot and decay when properly maintained.
settings.image_text:
• Cost-Effective: A budget-friendly option without compromising on quality.
  • Lightweight: Easier to handle and install compared to heavier gates.
  • Customisable: Can be easily painted or stained to match your property’s aesthetic.

settings.title: Hardwood Gate
settings.answer: Hardwood gates, such as those made from oak or Iroko, are known for their superior strength and durability. These gates offer a premium finish, making them ideal for entranceways that require both aesthetics and long-lasting performance.
settings.image_text:
• Durability: Hardwood is naturally resistant to decay, insects, and weathering.
  • Premium Appearance: Provides a high-end, elegant look for any entrance.
  • Low Maintenance: Requires minimal treatment and can last for decades with proper care.

settings.title: Iroko vs. Redwood
settings.text:
Still unsure of the difference between Iroko and Redwood? 

The main difference between Iroko and Redwood is the timber type. Redwood is a popular Softwood, whereas Iroko is a Hardwood - known for durability.

The other big difference is the lifespan. Redwood has a lifespan of around 15 years, whereas Iroko is 30 years (double the life time!). We do always recommend to treat both timbers with UV protection to ensure the gates keep both their colour and their quality.

settings.title: Gate Posts
settings.text:
We understand that each customer has a different set of requirements and wants, which is why we have a wide selection of posts available to compliment your gate.

Whether you would like Sawn Timber posts, Iroko Posts or Planed Redwood posts, we’ve got you covered.

settings.title: UV Protection
settings.text: We always recommend using UV Protection on your Pergola, at least every 6-12 months. This ensures your Pergola maintains its beautiful, natural colour and helps protect the timber against decay and the elements.

settings.title: Paint
settings.text: To match your Pergola seamlessly with your garden’s aesthetic, you can paint your Pergola. We recommend Osmo Paint, as this is water-based and available in various different colours.

settings.title: Things to Consider Purchasing with our Field Gates
Are your field gates pressure treated for durability?
settings.answer: Yes, all our softwood timber gates are pressure-treated to protect against rot and weathering, ensuring they withstand outdoor conditions over time.

settings.title: Do I need to treat the gate after installation?
settings.answer: While pressure-treated gates are protected, applying an additional wood preservative or stain can help maintain the gate's appearance and provide extra protection against the elements.

settings.title: Do you farm gates arrive with fixings and posts?
settings.answer: No, these will need to be purchased with your field gate.

settings.title: Do I need a throwover loop for double gates?
settings.answer: Yes, throwover loops are recommended for double field gates. They secure both sides of the gate, preventing them from swinging open and ensuring proper alignment when closed.

settings.title: Do you offer bespoke field gates?
settings.answer: Yes, we can make your gate to a custom measurement.

settings.title: What is the difference between softwood and hardwood gates?
settings.answer: Softwood gates are more affordable and lighter but require regular maintenance, while hardwood gates, like oak or iroko, offer greater strength, durability, and resistance to decay with less frequent upkeep.

settings.title: Can I use a field gate on a sloped surface?
settings.answer: Yes, field gates can be installed on sloped ground, but you may need to adjust the gate height or use custom hinges to ensure smooth operation and clearance over uneven terrain.

settings.title: What is the lifespan of a timber field gate?
settings.answer: With proper maintenance, timber field gates can last 15 to 30+ years or more, depending on the material (softwood or hardwood) and the level of exposure to the elements.

settings.title: Do your gates come pre-assembled?
settings.answer: Yes, our gates are delivered pre-assembled and ready for installation. All necessary fittings, such as hinges and latches, can be purchased separately or as part of a package.

settings.title: Can I automate my field gate?
settings.answer: We can custom-make field gates to be suitable for automation! Please contact our Sales team for further information and pricing.
